Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic, growing business unit within Amazon.com. Summary Fortune Magazine and the Great Place to Work Institute named Google the 2014 “Best Company Work For.” This marks our fifth time at the top of the list. While we’re honored to be included, what makes us proud is the recognition of the great contributions Googlers make to the communities in which we live and work. What’s truly makes Google a great place to work? Our people. 
 
For more information about how we support communities in more than 40 countries—from funding community park restorations and free public wi-fi to robotics training and volunteering—visit Google.org. Summary I have always been intrigued by what life could be on the other side of the pond. And whether grass can be greener than it is in Ireland. After 8 years @Google with 5@staffing I packed up and relocated to our global HQ in the Bay Area, Mountain View. 
 
Are the pastures greener than in County Kerry? No, definitely not but there are tons of palm trees.  
Is it overcast with give or take 3 degrees of 15 Celsius? No, always between 70-80 Fahrenheit ( you see, I am adjusting ;) Sunny and bright. With no humidity.  
Is it exciting to be at our global hub? ABSOLUTELY! 
Are there tons of opportunities within People Operations? The list is, guess what! Endless :) 
 
I am looking for driven leaders w/ strong recruitment strategy/operations, talent acquisition/technical sourcing background with solid experience in managing large recruiting/talent sourcing teams + a genuine passion for talent acquisition :) 
And full cycle recruiters, sourcers w/ robust technical background. 
And analysts. 
And HRBPs. 
And admin assistants for execs. 
And researchers. 
And college recruiters. 
See? Told you! Endless. 
 
Interested? Let me know! Happy to connect :) 
 
Have I forgotten about Dublin EU HQ? Never! Happy to connect: 
- senior executives w/ solid track record of people management+ internal stakeholder management from online/consulting/strategic sales/agency background for Spanish/French/Polish/Benelux/Nordic/Russian markets  
- Norwegian/Danish/Finnish/Swedish/German/Dutch/French/Spanish/Italian speakers w/ solid client facing sales/consulting/business strategy/online advertising/digital media/agency exp 
 
For our current openings check: http://www.google.ie/about/careers/locations/mountain-view/ . Summary I was that thoughtful kid always posing the question, "Why are things done this way?, Can it be done better?"​. I'm a customer focused strategic sourcing professional always evaluating a situation using a comprehensive approach. Can we tackle this problem outside the box to drive efficiencies that streamline processes that are cost effective, make sense, and provide the best value for the customer? 
 
I've always been able to pick up project with limited direction. A self starter who quickly adapts to processes and policies then goes a step further to implement ways to improve the procurement process for the customer and organization. I've been instrumental on projects that reduce PO volume, processing time, and produce total cost of ownership savings for my clients. I've received multiple kudos from clients and my team that my efforts are valued and drive a better procurement experience.  
 
Procurement isn't a roadblock. Procurement is a valued partner and enabler. Procurement processes help clients procure the supplies and services they need to run their business efficiently and effectively, drive best-in-class supplier relationships, and provide cost savings to the organizations we serve.
